Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts
Show more

Title: (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch)
Description:
Über uns

Getreu unserem Motto – People is what makes us us – sind uns deine nachhaltige Ausbildung und Weiterentwicklung, deine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance und deine Happiness sehr wichtig. Konkret stellen wir mit 32 Urlaubstagen, 60 % mobilem Arbeiten, bis zu 4 Wochen pro Jahr – im europäischen Ausland – der Möglichkeit remote zu arbeiten, Sabbatical und Überstundenausgleich sicher, dass dir im FUSE-Agentur-Leben nichts fehlt.

In unserem derzeit über 60-köpfigen Team sowie unseren Kund*innen haben wir unser perfektes Match bereits gefunden. Wenn du noch auf der Suche bist, bei „popkulturellem Relevanzmarketing“ neugierig wirst und für Social Media, Influencer Marketing oder Gaming & Esports brennst, dann lass uns zusammen loslegen! Denn : Action Creates Impact .

Dein Job

Als (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch) bearbeitest du als Teil unseres Data und Analytics Teams in erster Linie die Anfragen unserer Kunden nach Social Media Reportings sowie Social Listening Analysen und beherrschst den Spagat zwischen analytischem und kreativem Denken, um die Kolleg:Innen in deinem und anderen Teams mit datenbasierten Insights zu Kundenmeinungen, Märkten, Zielgruppen, Marken und ihren Social Media-Umfeldern zu versorgen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Datenbeschaffung / Toolbedienung

Du bist präzise, schnell, zuverlässig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung großer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsfähig, dich diesbezüglich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere Lösungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine täglichen Begleiter.

Studiendurchführung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes Gespür für Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu können, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schließlich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht rüberzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei Präsentationen.

Datenanalyse

Auswertungslogiken passend zu den gegebenen Fragestellungen und Erkenntnisinteressen erstellen, Dimensionierungen & Kategorisierungen für Inhaltsanalysen planen und entwickeln, Daten auszählen, filtern, darstellen, vergleichen, interpretieren, daraus kreative Idee und Empfehlungen ableiten. Das ist dein Playground. Deine Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souveräner Umgang auch mit großen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind für dich selbstverständlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen Fähigkeiten, auch ein Gespür für gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbständig, willst aber auch noch ständig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf Höhe des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse für unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. Außerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erfährst du stets Rückenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest für Kunden - die unsere Werte „BOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.“ leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
Show more

Title: Environmental Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your tasks


Collecting, processing, and handling energy and water data for ESG/non-financial reporting.
Supporting the analysis and implementation of digital solutions and procedures for data collection and reporting.
Training operational teams and other departments on new processes and tools for data management.
Coordinating with multiple departments to manage incoming energy data from various sources.
Ensuring completeness and performing quality checks on incoming energy data.
Assisting in developing reports and analysis to support business decisions.
Implementing and ensuring compliance with reporting standards (e.g., CSRD, EU taxonomy).



Your profile


Master’s degree in engineering, energy, environmental sciences, or economic sciences.
Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
Strong analytical skills, self-driven, and highly motivated.
Proficiency in MS Excel and good knowledge of MS Office.
Experience with environmental data management tools is a plus.
Familiarity with reporting standards such as CSRD, EPRA, GRI, and CDP is beneficial.
Knowledge of real estate, including residential, commercial, and hospitality sectors.
Excellent communication skills in both English and German.



Your perspective


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Good working atmosphere, communication culture “on a first-name basis” and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training and coaching for professional and personal development in our Academy and with our in-house business coach
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and courses at the headquarters in Berlin as well as fitness and health offers through the Wellhub platform at all external locations
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Support on the way to work through a subsidy for the use of public transport and the option of leasing a bicycle through Eurorad
Modern IT equipment such as laptop and cell phone
Mobility and flexibility through the use of pool cars and company cars to carry out tasks
Flexible working hours and mobile working for an even better work-life balance
Exciting virtual range of family-friendly benefits, including vacation programs, leisure and sports activities and consulting services with our partner company Voiio
Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts in selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and drinks
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruit



Have we sparked your interest?

Then click on "Apply Now" below, and Maryam Al-Dolaimy looks forward to receiving your compelling application documents, including your earliest possible start date and salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Personalabteilung, Wittestraße 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
Salesforce Developer – Commerce Focus

Berlin

Hybrid (3 days onsite)







Are you an experienced Salesforce Developer with a passion for e-commerce and expertise in Salesforce Order Management System (OMS)? Join a leading force in the gaming and tech industry, where we create cutting-edge online shopping experiences.




The Role

As a Salesforce Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing Salesforce Commerce Cloud and OMS solutions. Your work will directly impact online store performance, order management processes, and customer experience.




What You’ll Be Doing

Salesforce Commerce Cloud Development – Build and maintain scalable e-commerce solutions.
OMS Optimization – Streamline order processing, fulfillment, inventory, and returns.
Customization & Integration – Develop APIs and integrate third-party systems (payment gateways, shipping providers).
Performance Tuning – Enhance system efficiency for seamless customer journeys.
Collaboration – Work with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative e-commerce solutions.




What We’re Looking For

3+ years of Salesforce Development experience with a focus on Commerce & OMS.
Strong skills in Apex, Visualforce, JavaScript, and web technologies.
Knowledge of e-commerce best practices and trends.
Experience with Git, Agile methodologies, and API integrations.
Passion for gaming and tech is a plus.




Location




What’s in It for You?




Competitive salary & benefits package
Work with cutting-edge e-commerce technology
Career growth and development opportunities
A collaborative and innovative work environment




Interested? Apply now or reach out for more details.

Show more

Title: Data Science & Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About

Daten sind der Schlüssel zu besseren Entscheidungen – auch in der Finanzwelt. Mit smarten Technologien und innovativen Analysen machen wir Geldanlage transparenter, effizienter und zugänglicher. Unser Ziel - Menschen befähigen, ihre Zukunft selbstbestimmt zu gestalten.

Wir kombinieren fundierte wissenschaftliche Strategien mit moderner Technologie. Mit einem starken Tech-Stack, agilen Methoden und einer klaren Vision entwickeln wir smarte Anwendungen, die unseren Kund:innen helfen, bessere finanzielle Entscheidungen zu treffen. Gemeinsam mit quirion, unserer digitalen Tochter, verwalten wir über 9 Milliarden Euro für mehr als 100.000 Kund:innen – und zeigen jeden Tag, wie wir Menschen in Deutschland zu besseren Anlegern machen.

Nice-to-have skills


SQL
Innovation
Google Analytics
Google Data Studio
Marketing
Data Science
AWS
Google Analytics
Google Tag Manager
Google Data Studio
Power BI
SQL
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Business Intelligence


Languages


German
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?
Show more

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Entyre, our mission is to reduce both under and over-provision of healthcare through the intelligent combination of human expertise and technology. Our dedicated care consultants work tirelessly on an international level, supported by our proprietary software solutions.

We believe that individuals in need of care, who are looked after by their relatives at home, have the right to live a self-determined and dignified life in their own homes. With our brands Pflegewegweiser and Entyre Care, we are committed to achieving this goal by focusing on two central pillars: providing professional support to caregiving relatives in all areas of home care with our extensive expertise and ensuring fair monetary compensation for their efforts. We are also driving the development of innovative solutions in collaboration with scientific partners.

In this vital, dynamic, and international environment, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.







Key Responsibilities

Develop data models with DBT on DataBricks for marketing, sales and operations
Develop optimized SQL queries to aggregate and explore data from multiple datasets, identify opportunities and limitations within our data sets and deliver reliable and high quality analysis to drive strategic insights.
Translate complex data insights into compelling narratives that drive action across marketing and leadership teams.
Enable teams with self-service analytics by maintaining curated data sources and developing automated, scalable dashboards by applying intuitive data visualization and dashboard design best practices.
Own key projects and respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external stakeholders. Define, calculate, and validate key performance metrics (KPIs), identifying automation opportunities and developing self-service analytics solutions.
Communicate with stakeholders on various projects to gather requirements, collect feedback and present deliverables to achieve expected outcomes.
Brainstorm creative solutions to exploratory projects built around ambiguity, including running analysis to identify problems, understand root cause of trends, provide actionable insights and recommend solutions.
Work collaboratively and cross functionally with other members of the data team to support testing/experimentation, data modeling, data visualization & data science.
Collaborate with data scientists to leverage A/B testing and incrementality analysis to measure marketing effectiveness and optimize campaign performance.




Value Proposition

Make a Life-Changing Impact: Your analyses will directly contribute to improving the lives of millions. You will play a crucial role in helping low-income families access quality homecare.
Personal Growth and Learning Opportunities: Join a vibrant, dedicated team and contribute to building the next industry-defining company. You’ll gain exposure to various aspects of the business while expanding your skills.
Energizing & Flat Hierarchy Team Culture: We care deeply about one another and are committed to collaboration and teamwork. You’ll have the autonomy to drive your initiatives and make a meaningful impact.




Hard Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of experience in growth marketing analytics, data science, preferably in direct-to-consumer and e-commerce companies.
Experience with marketing analytics, attribution modelling, customer segmentation, and predictive modelling for growth and retention.
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in either Python (or R) for advanced data analysis and automation. Experience with dbt, Looker, or other modern analytics tools is a plus.
Familiarity with B2C acquisition and subscription marketing concepts and metrics, including customer journeys, conversion funnels and critical reporting (CAC, payback, retention rate, etc.).
Hands-on experience working with structured and unstructured data in cloud-based environments, like Databricks, BigQuery etc.
Comfortable navigating large datasets, acquiring and cleansing data from multiple sources.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, a self-motivated approach to problem-solving, and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to be a self starter and work independently.
Advanced data visualization skills
Familiarity with marketing, CRM, social and ad platforms, such as HubSpot, Google Ads, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and others. Experience with partnership and affiliate marketing is a plus.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
Ability to collaborate with partners to document key business needs into a clearly defined requirements document and project plan.
Proven skills in distilling complex topics into easy to understand data visualizations. Advanced Tableau data visualization skills preferred.







Soft Requirements

Passionate and Impact-Driven: You thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to contribute to transformational change in the healthcare industry.
Strategic Thinker: You have strong strategic thinking abilities combined with a hands-on execution mindset. You understand the importance of data in driving marketing initiatives.
Detail-Oriented: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in data analysis and reporting.
Open-Minded and Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and have a willingness to learn and adapt. You view challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in redefining homecare!

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Job Title: Research Associate

Location: West London with hybrid working 2-3 days in the office.

Salary: £28,000-36,000 per annum (depending on experience)




Are you passionate about data and market research? We’re seeking a Research Associate to join our dynamic research & consultancy business.




In this role, you’ll undertake international research, analyse data, and contribute to insightful reports across the banking, retail technology, and payments sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in market intelligence.




What you’ll do:

Conduct primary and secondary research, including surveys and executive interviews
Analyse data and produce reports for industry leaders
Contribute to newsletters and consulting projects
Work independently and as part of larger teams on global projects
Take on project management responsibilities as you progress




What we’re looking for:

Minimum two years' post-degree experience (not necessarily in research)
Strong writing, communication, and numerical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Language skills are a bonus in particular European languages




Why Join them?

This company are committed to supporting your professional development, offering a diverse and collaborative working environment. If you’re looking to develop a career in market intelligence, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst - Dataiku
Description:
Headline Notes Before Application:

Hybrid Permanent Role In London - Salary £40-50k

**MUST have Dataiku / SQL & PYTHON Experience**

Sector: Financial Services

No Graduate Visa's / Sponsorship Offered




We are recruiting for a Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless transition and efficient operation of data projects from the QA environment to production. In this role, you will be responsible for:




Issue Resolution & Escalation: Proactively resolving issues impacting critical data projects and escalating them when necessary.
Domain Expertise & Continuous Learning: Enhancing project outcomes through deep domain knowledge and fostering continuous learning within the team.
Service Monitoring & Data Insights: Utilising tools such as Dataiku, Alteryx, Tableau, and PowerBI to develop dashboards, monitor service metrics, and deliver actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Automation & Efficiency: Leveraging SQL, Python, and R to identify automation opportunities and streamline support and maintenance processes.
Documentation Management: Ensuring accurate and up-to-date documentation across processes, systems, and team structures.
Project Prioritisation & Promotion: Supporting project prioritisation and assisting in the controlled promotion of data projects from QA to production.
Backup & Disaster Recovery: Contributing to the development and implementation of robust backup and disaster recovery strategies.
Environment Health Checks: Conducting regular health checks on QA and production environments to guarantee system stability and optimal performance.

Knowledge and Experience

Experience with Alteryx: Essential for managing data workflows.
Software Delivery: Proven track record of delivering high-quality, unit-tested software within a commercial environment.
Design Principles: Practical experience in applying appropriate design patterns and principles.
Financial Sector Exposure: FX and broader financial knowledge is desirable, along with experience in financial systems.

Technical Skills

Data Engineering: Proficiency in using Alteryx and Dataiku
Data Visualisation: Experience with Tableau and PowerBI.
Programming: Strong coding skills in SQL, Python, and R.

Personal Attributes

Proactive: A self-starter with the ability to make an immediate and tangible impact.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous in ensuring precision and quality.
Resourceful: Capable of navigating challenges with innovative solutions.
Collaborative: Thrives in a team-based environment.
Innovative: Continuously seeks new ways to enhance processes and drive success.




Additional Information

This is a full-time, permanent position offering a hybrid working arrangement within the IT team based in the London office. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment, catering to a diverse mix of stakeholders and contributing to a rapidly evolving fintech landscape.




What You Get in Return

Along with a competitive salary, this role offers an attractive benefits package that includes private medical health insurance.

If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and join a leading fintech bank on its growth journey, we encourage you to apply and be part of a company that is redefining the future of payments.

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc. 

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).




We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you'll do:
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. 
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus








About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject Experience in analysing data.
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Graduate Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:Working as a Data Science Analyst, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.
Show more
HTML:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:

  • Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject Experience in analysing data.
  • Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
  • Ability to work on site 5 days a week.


Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Graduate Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:Working as a Data Science Analyst, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
Start Date: ASAP
Position: Permanent (12 Month FTC)  
Location / Remote Working: London / Hybrid (1 day on site per week)
Salary: 35 – 40K Annually
 
Summary

Trust in Soda has formed an exclusive partnership with a prominent finance company in search of a talented Data Analyst. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with the business to evaluate and gain deeper insights into their decision-making processes.
 
Essentials

Experience assessing effectiveness of Lead Generation and Marketing
Proven ability to manage extensive datasets and work with relational databases.
Advanced expertise in SQL, including crafting comprehensive procedures from the ground up.
Proficiency in using data visualization platforms like PowerBI and Tableau.
Skilled in leveraging Python for ETL processes and data analysis tasks.
In-depth knowledge of A/B testing and statistical significance methodologies to evaluate marketing effectiveness.
Established background as a Data Analyst or in an equivalent analytical role.
Strong capability to see how their contributions align with overarching business objectives.
Excel at fostering and maintaining robust relationships across the organization.
Competent in juggling multiple responsibilities while ensuring deadlines are met.
A passionate drive to enhance processes and uncover innovative opportunities through data exploration.
 
Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with key stakeholders to design and manage an extensive suite of dashboards.
Build and maintain integrations that support origination channels and initiatives.
Conduct and evaluate A/B testing to enhance marketing performance.
Assess lead opportunities, actions, and results to determine success potential and highlight areas for improvement.
Deliver analytical insights to key stakeholders in a straightforward and clear format to ensure easy comprehension.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of London’s largest property maintenance teams. We’re always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. We’re looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. You’ll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




💰 £80,000-£100,000

🖥️ SQL, Snowflake, Data Visualisation

🌍 London, 3 days in office

📈 Sports market research & analytics for the gaming industry




We are partnered with a leading provider of analytics solutions in the sports gaming industry, who leverage real-time data and insights to enhance decision-making. They are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team to play in critical role in supporting data driven initiatives within this industry.




The role...

You will work with large datasets and create reports that drive business decisions. The ideal candidate will be proficient in SQL and Snowflake, with a strong understanding of the sports gaming landscape.




What you'll be doing...

You will analyse large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights relevant to the sports gaming industry.
You will write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from Snowflake.
You will develop dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for internal teams and stakeholders.
You will optimise data processing performance within Snowflake.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business intelligence teams, to support data-driven decision-making.
You will stay updated on the latest developments in data analytics and identify opportunities to automate data processing and reporting tasks.




What they're looking for...

Technical expertise with SQL.
Hands-on experience with Snowflake.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Experience in the sports gaming or betting industry is highly preferred.




If you are interested in finding out more, please apply or contact me directly!




📧 jordanf@burnssheehan.co.uk




Data Analyst




💰 £80,000-£100,000

🖥️ SQL, Snowflake, Data Visualisation

🌍 London, 3 days in office

📈 Sports market research & analytics for the gaming industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Exponential-e

Want to be part of a leading British-owned tech company? Established in 2002, we are achieving year on year revenue growth and reinvesting 95% of our profits back into our people and technology.







Your new role:

Collect, analyse, and interpret revenue operations data to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth
Working with the systems team, develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for leadership and revenue teams
Support revenue forecasting, pipeline analysis, and performance tracking
Ensure data integrity and consistency across the different platforms and tools
Conduct revenue analysis, churn analysis, and customer segmentation to improve retention and lifetime value (LTV)







What you’ll need to succeed:

Degree in Data Analytics, Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field
Experience in data analysis, preferably in a Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or Marketing Analytics role
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Sisense, Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Experience working with CRM platforms (Salesforce) and marketing automation tools







What we offer:

Involved in varied projects that make a positive impact on critical services on a local and national level
Range of employee initiatives on offer including the green team, employee forum, women’s network and culture club
Dedicated Learning and Development team and access to a range of training, courses and certification support
Comprehensive benefits including on-site cafe with free barista coffee, birthday leave, charity leave, vitality health cover and holiday purchase scheme to gain an extra 5 days leave!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Ometria is a Customer Data and Experience Platform built for retail marketers to be the fastest route to sustainable growth. Ometria helps marketers plan and launch their most profitable campaigns twice as fast, increasing their customer loyalty and CRM revenue with personalised marketing messages all throughout the customer journey.

Our platform combines the data unification and customer insight of a CDP with an experience platform, letting retail marketers easily and efficiently create experiences their customers love across email, mobile, on-site, social, direct mail and more.

Ometria is trusted by some of the fastest-growing retail brands in the world such as Brooklinen, Davines, Steve Madden, and Sephora.

We have a team of over 120 Ometrians based in North America and Europe. We have raised $75m from leading venture capital funds across the world such as Infravia Capital Partners, Octopus Ventures, Summit Action, Sonae IM and many others.

The role

We are looking for a Business Data Analyst to inform and support key stakeholders in interpreting and analysing data, identifying trends, and generating recommendations to guide strategic decisions. In this role, you will play a pivotal part of our continued success in the UK but also support our US expansion plans and help us win there.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will work in the Retail Strategy team, reporting to the Chief Customer Officer, and will collaborate with other client-facing teams such as Customer Success, Marketing, Sales, and with the senior management team to deliver data-driven insights.

You'll play a key role in ensuring that our clients and prospects rightly perceive Ometria as the foremost data-driven Customer Data and Experience Platform platform.

Key outcomes


Lead the workstreams involving data extraction, transformation, analysis, visualisation for Ometria's Architect 360 offering - our innovative, AI-driven consultancy solution, designed to uncover hidden revenue opportunities within a customer's data - ensuring that both the retail intelligence team and the customer success team can deliver Architect 360 effectively, and contributing to this offering's continuous improvement
Partner with our client-facing teams to extract, transform and present data on specific client projects to demonstrate that Ometria is the foremost retail-focused CDXP, prioritising the activities based on client urgency, importance and impact
Partner with internal-facing teams to extract insights that can drive decisions on our product or how we serve our clients
Collaborate with the product & engineering team to ensure our data architecture keeps improving to enable the level of analysis Ometria's clients need



Key Responsibilities


Be the subject matter expert when it comes to data in the Ometria platform: what is available, what it means, how to access and analyse it, potential constraints or limitations
Partner with the Retail Strategy team to design Ometria Architect 360 deliverables, and create and manage tools to enable the team to access the relevant data in a scalable manner
Translate high-level client requirements into specific data projects, and translate the outcomes and insights back into commercially meaningful language
Lead the provision of ad hoc data and insights to various parts of the business, utilising suitable tools such as python, SQL, spreadsheets, etc
Represent the data analysis function (if required) in communication with clients, in collaboration with the Retail Strategy, Customer Success, Sales and Marketing teams
Collaborate with the marketing team to identify data-driven stories within our datasets that can be turned into engaging content



Requirements

Requirements


You have at least 3-4 years of experience as a business analyst or data analyst in a dynamic, fast-paced environment; retail focus preferred
You have experience extracting data from databases using SQL and analysing data using Python (NumPy, Pandas, etc.)
You have a bachelor degree in a quantitative subject
You are capable of acting as a trusted advisor when presenting data and insights to key stakeholders in multiple departments, especially those that are client-facing
You are able to see the bigger picture when looking at data and interpreting it from a commercial and pragmatic, result-oriented perspective
You have a proactive, inquisitive mindset when it comes to using data to identify business opportunities and insights
You are comfortable working with multiple key stakeholders across different departments within the business (e.g. Customer Success, Marketing, Sales, etc.), ensuring that they are up-to-date and at all times have all the information they need to manage their external stakeholders
You are able to communicate in a clear, concise and commercially-driven manner
You can manage multiple priorities at the same time, and are comfortable switching to the activity that matters the most as priorities change
You are organised, disciplined and consistent in the way you manage your time, tools, data, insights, and outputs
You consider different approaches to solving a problem, and pick the one that is most pragmatic and effective to achieve the desired business outcomes



Benefits


30 days holiday + 1 day on your birthday (plus bank holidays)
Health Insurance (Bupa)
Mental Health Support (Spill, Calm)
Cycle to work scheme
Enhanced Financial Benefits (Salary Sacrifice Pension, DIS, Income Protection)


The amazing people of Ometria are the core of our business. We believe in making it

awesome to be here for all Ometrians and place a continued focus on making Ometria

an inclusive, respectful and diverse environment.

We're an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered for

employment without attention to ethnicity, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender

identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or

disability status.

Key outcomes

  • Lead the workstreams involving data extraction, transformation, analysis, visualisation for Ometria's Architect 360 offering - our innovative, AI-driven consultancy solution, designed to uncover hidden revenue opportunities within a customer's data - ensuring that both the retail intelligence team and the customer success team can deliver Architect 360 effectively, and contributing to this offering's continuous improvement
  • Partner with our client-facing teams to extract, transform and present data on specific client projects to demonstrate that Ometria is the foremost retail-focused CDXP, prioritising the activities based on client urgency, importance and impact
  • Partner with internal-facing teams to extract insights that can drive decisions on our product or how we serve our clients
  • Collaborate with the product & engineering team to ensure our data architecture keeps improving to enable the level of analysis Ometria's clients need


Key Responsibilities

  • Be the subject matter expert when it comes to data in the Ometria platform: what is available, what it means, how to access and analyse it, potential constraints or limitations
  • Partner with the Retail Strategy team to design Ometria Architect 360 deliverables, and create and manage tools to enable the team to access the relevant data in a scalable manner
  • Translate high-level client requirements into specific data projects, and translate the outcomes and insights back into commercially meaningful language
  • Lead the provision of ad hoc data and insights to various parts of the business, utilising suitable tools such as python, SQL, spreadsheets, etc
  • Represent the data analysis function (if required) in communication with clients, in collaboration with the Retail Strategy, Customer Success, Sales and Marketing teams
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to identify data-driven stories within our datasets that can be turned into engaging content


Requirements

Requirements

  • You have at least 3-4 years of experience as a business analyst or data analyst in a dynamic, fast-paced environment; retail focus preferred
  • You have experience extracting data from databases using SQL and analysing data using Python (NumPy, Pandas, etc.)
  • You have a bachelor degree in a quantitative subject
  • You are capable of acting as a trusted advisor when presenting data and insights to key stakeholders in multiple departments, especially those that are client-facing
  • You are able to see the bigger picture when looking at data and interpreting it from a commercial and pragmatic, result-oriented perspective
  • You have a proactive, inquisitive mindset when it comes to using data to identify business opportunities and insights
  • You are comfortable working with multiple key stakeholders across different departments within the business (e.g. Customer Success, Marketing, Sales, etc.), ensuring that they are up-to-date and at all times have all the information they need to manage their external stakeholders
  • You are able to communicate in a clear, concise and commercially-driven manner
  • You can manage multiple priorities at the same time, and are comfortable switching to the activity that matters the most as priorities change
  • You are organised, disciplined and consistent in the way you manage your time, tools, data, insights, and outputs
  • You consider different approaches to solving a problem, and pick the one that is most pragmatic and effective to achieve the desired business outcomes


Benefits

  • 30 days holiday + 1 day on your birthday (plus bank holidays)
  • Health Insurance (Bupa)
  • Mental Health Support (Spill, Calm)
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Enhanced Financial Benefits (Salary Sacrifice Pension, DIS, Income Protection)

The amazing people of Ometria are the core of our business. We believe in making it

awesome to be here for all Ometrians and place a continued focus on making Ometria

an inclusive, respectful and diverse environment.

We're an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered for

employment without attention to ethnicity, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender

identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or

disability status.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject Experience in analysing data.
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Graduate Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:Working as a Data Science Analyst, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, UK
Description:
Rakuten Viber is one of the most popular and downloaded apps in the world. Working with us provides a unique opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of our users and to be part of the journey that makes us a super-app. Our mission is to make people’s lives easier by enabling meaningful connections, from precious moments with family and friends, through managing business relationships to pursuing their passions.

Our Data Analyst team provides insights on how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Business Solutions unit and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker, etc.) and a business mindset.

Responsibilities:


Deliver cutting-edge analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels, and analytical functions
Report on key performance metrics against targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Liaise with stakeholders, such as Product, Marketing, Analytics and Data Science teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in improving user experiences
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports, and data models


Requirements:


4-5 years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Knowledge of A/B testing principles and statistical analysis techniques
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field


Advantages:


Experience in product analytics role with driving impact and shaping product direction
Experience with Python and ETL
Experience with simple ML algorithms and technical skills
Show more
