Title: Senior Analytics and Data Engineer
Description:
Read more about Rivian and VW Group Technologies (R | V Tech)  in our November 2024 Press Release. 

 

R | V Tech’s Core Data Team is searching for a talented Analytics and Data Engineer or a Senior Analytics and Data Engineer to design and implement scalable Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) pipelines, develop SQL and Python-based transformation logic, and ensure our data infrastructure supports seamless interaction with data across the company.

 

In this role, the Analytics and Data Engineer will set the standard for R | V Tech’s Data Engineering best practices while also contributing to high-impact projects and enabling teams to leverage data eﬀortlessly.

 

This joint venture is experiencing significant growth, and this role will focus on selecting and building patterns that enable us to scale eﬃciently while maintaining high standards of data quality and accessibility. 

 

 

Design, build, and maintain scalable Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) pipelines and workflows that transform raw data into actionable insights.

Develop and optimize SQL and Python-based transformation code to process and curate data for analytics and reporting.

Architect data models and schemas that enable self-service analytics and ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs, create reusable data patterns, and implement best practices.

Monitor and improve the performance and reliability of data pipelines, platform and infrastructure.

Champion data quality through validation processes, monitoring frameworks, and automated testing.

Partner with platform engineers to integrate new tools, technologies, and frameworks into the data ecosystem.

Act as a mentor and thought leader for the data engineering community within the organization.

Streamline tools and processes, mature existing patterns, and establish new patterns as needed scale gracefully across ingestion, governance and analytics to allow the organization to scale gracefully.

What We Value: 

Coming Together to lead the way: 

Two Industry Leaders combining to have  a clear vision for automotive’s next chapter. 

Addressing the challenges of electric vehicles through technologies that will set the standards for SDVs around the world.  

Innovation at Scale: Passion for building world-class distributed systems that are robust, efficient, and scalable.

Diverse Collaboration: Someone who has a strong ability to collaborate and communicate effectively in a team-oriented environment. By combining our unique backgrounds, Rivian’s EV Innovator and VW’s Longtime Automotive Leader, we can tackle big challenges from fresh angles. 

Global Impact: We want to accelerate the global transition to electric vehicles, helping create safer roadways and a more sustainable planet for everyone. 

Why Join the Core Data Team?



Real-World Impact: See your ideas drive real-world impact across some of the world’s most recognized car brands.

New Challenges: From zonal architecture to in-vehicle intelligence, work on cutting-edge technologies and challenging technical problems to define what’s next for the automotive experience.

Engineering-Led: Thrive in an Engineering-Centric Culture that embraces first principles thinking to build scalable solutions. 

Highly Collaborative: Collaborate with teams of talented passionate Engineers and who believe the best work comes from bringing bold and diverse thinkers together. 

Opportunities: Professional Development, Career Advancement, and Tuition Reimbursement.

Benefits: Health, Well-Being, Financial, and LGBTQIA2+ Benefits start on Day 1

Time Away from Work: We’re passionate about creating a better way to explore the world, which includes a variety of ways to give Employees the time they need to rest, recharge, and go exploring. 

Cultivating Inclusion and Belonging: Read our 2024 Impact Report to learn more about our beliefs that inclusivity and equity are essential for meaningful and lasting social and environmental solutions.

You might be a great fit if you also happen to be a fan of Data, Food, and Pets.

 

 

Required:

Office Location Requirement: Ability to work from R | V Tech’s Yaletown Office at least three days per week is required for this role.

Work From Home: Ability to work from home two days a week is supported as well. 

On-Call: Participation in a rotating on-call schedule, including occasional weekends, late nights, and holidays, to resolve critical production issues is also required.

Education: At least a Bachelor’s Degree is required for this role. 

Experience: At least 2 years of professional experience is needed for this role. 

Data Engineering and  Data Analytics

Building and Managing data platforms.

BI and Analytics tools like Tableau, Looker, and Microsoft Power BI, along with their integration into data platforms.

Skills: 

Strong communication and collaboration skills are essential to excel in this role as our Core Data Team partners with and supports colleagues across the business with varying levels of technical expertise.

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for creating eﬃcient, maintainable, and scalable data systems.

Expertise in SQL and Python for data transformation and pipeline development. 

Programming languages for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.

Preferred:

Bachelor’s Degree with a major in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar discipline is highly preferred.

Master's Degree or PhD is highly preferred but not required.

Strong experience with Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) patterns and modern data stack tools such as fivetran, dbt, Databricks (preferred), Snowflake, BigQuery is highly desirable. 

Experience with any data quality, data security and monitoring initiatives is preferred. 

Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow or similar is also preferred. 

 

Show more

Title: Senior Manager - Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your role:

We are looking for a dynamic Analytics Senior Manager to join our growing team to lead data analytics initiatives in identifying business needs, aligning analytics execution with our analytics vision and strategy, and manage the processes and people responsible for accurate data collection, processing, modeling and analysis. The ideal candidate has the insight and experience to distinguish between projects that range from prototype to scalable long-term analytics solutions and is able to manage these varying degrees of project complexity and outcomes with business stakeholders. A business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for Global Relay is a necessity for this role. You will work closely with leaders across Accounting & Finance, Product, Sales, Customer Success, Customer Support and Marketing to support and implement high-quality, data-solutions that drive business decisions.

Your responsibilities:



Refine the Analytics vision and strategy for broader adoption of analytics across Finance, Sales, Customer Support, Marketing and Product, working collaboratively with other data teams to deliver value to the organization through data insights
Define multi-year analytics roadmaps by working closely with key business stakeholders to identify analytics business needs, detail requirements and crawl, walk, run adoption approaches
Use extensive knowledge of advanced data modelling techniques to evaluate initiatives for business value, complexity and feasibility to recommend prioritization of initiatives to business stakeholders
Oversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.
Manage and optimize processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modeling, visualization and communication deliverables
Develop and implement quality controls and departmental standards to ensure organizational quality expectations, data security and regulatory requirements are adhered to
Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology and business within your department to design and implement solutions to meet these needs
Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with stakeholders
Manage our data and analytics platform products throughout the entire product development lifecycle, from discovery and experimentation to launch and make sure the Analytics platform is accessed and used in alignment with our Analytics vision and centre of excellence governance process
Play a key role in forming an Analytics Centre of Excellence and fostering close collaboration across Data and Business Analysts who will be the area subject matter experts across various domains within the organization
Define data governance standards and identify areas of improving data quality that will aid improved reporting
Define guiding principles and monitor their adherence for data and business analyst users when creating dashboards from corporate data sets or when defining their own data sets



About you:



5 to 8 years of experience in an Analytics leadership role setting strategies, vision and developing roadmaps
Experience of creating Analytical products for both internal business stakeholders and external customers with specific focus on secure data sharing between both
Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities effectively
Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations
Is someone who is continuously curious about the ever-changing advanced data analytics space and keeps their craft sharpened at all times
Has a willingness to create analytical prototypes where the need arises to drive decision making and aid planning for longer term scalability
Deep understanding of Data Management platforms and the role they play in scalable analytics
Ability to communicate Data Management needs to aid Analytics with sufficient understanding and insight to drive close collaboration and product development across Analytics and Data Management teams
Strong business acumen and the ability to relate to varying business stakeholder audiences to link concepts to needs and outcomes using story telling with data techniques
Has a track record of driving analytics maturity and adoption and the ability to scale the use of Analytics supported by effective strategy alignment, data governance and analytics community guidance to prioritize initiatives
Proficient in using Confluence, Jira and Product Board to organize, plan and document all analytics requirements, projects, roadmaps and procedures
Values precision and accuracy in defining, scoping, building and presenting data products
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and exceptional communication skills allowing for effective work with a variety of different departments
Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint and the ability to conceptualize and visualize ideas in Miro
Experience in a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) subscription environment is a definite asset
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM system and cloud-based accounting applications like NetSuite an asset
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with a solution-based mindset
Strong work ethic and integrity with the ability to exercise tact and discretion and to be entrusted with confidential information



Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia’s pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$160,000—$200,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

  • Develop and implement quality controls and departmental standards to ensure organizational quality expectations, data security and regulatory requirements are adhered to
  • Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology and business within your department to design and implement solutions to meet these needs
  • Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with stakeholders
  • Manage our data and analytics platform products throughout the entire product development lifecycle, from discovery and experimentation to launch and make sure the Analytics platform is accessed and used in alignment with our Analytics vision and centre of excellence governance process
  • Play a key role in forming an Analytics Centre of Excellence and fostering close collaboration across Data and Business Analysts who will be the area subject matter experts across various domains within the organization
  • Define data governance standards and identify areas of improving data quality that will aid improved reporting
  • Define guiding principles and monitor their adherence for data and business analyst users when creating dashboards from corporate data sets or when defining their own data sets


About you:


  • 5 to 8 years of experience in an Analytics leadership role setting strategies, vision and developing roadmaps
  • Experience of creating Analytical products for both internal business stakeholders and external customers with specific focus on secure data sharing between both
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities effectively
  • Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations
  • Is someone who is continuously curious about the ever-changing advanced data analytics space and keeps their craft sharpened at all times
  • Has a willingness to create analytical prototypes where the need arises to drive decision making and aid planning for longer term scalability
  • Deep understanding of Data Management platforms and the role they play in scalable analytics
  • Ability to communicate Data Management needs to aid Analytics with sufficient understanding and insight to drive close collaboration and product development across Analytics and Data Management teams
  • Strong business acumen and the ability to relate to varying business stakeholder audiences to link concepts to needs and outcomes using story telling with data techniques
  • Has a track record of driving analytics maturity and adoption and the ability to scale the use of Analytics supported by effective strategy alignment, data governance and analytics community guidance to prioritize initiatives
  • Proficient in using Confluence, Jira and Product Board to organize, plan and document all analytics requirements, projects, roadmaps and procedures
  • Values precision and accuracy in defining, scoping, building and presenting data products
  • Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and exceptional communication skills allowing for effective work with a variety of different departments
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint and the ability to conceptualize and visualize ideas in Miro
  • Experience in a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) subscription environment is a definite asset
  • Familiarity with Salesforce CRM system and cloud-based accounting applications like NetSuite an asset
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with a solution-based mindset
  • Strong work ethic and integrity with the ability to exercise tact and discretion and to be entrusted with confidential information


Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia’s pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$160,000—$200,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Role:

Leyton Match has been retained by a leading AI-powered sales enablement company to help them find an exceptional Data Scientist to join their Vancouver office. This is a unique opportunity for a highly motivated and dynamic individual who is passionate about data science and eager to make a tangible impact in the rapidly growing field of AI sales tools.




In this hybrid role, you will be working closely with senior leadership, including directly reporting to the CEO. You will leverage your data science expertise to generate actionable insights while also taking on data analysis tasks when necessary. We are seeking a candidate who is not only technically proficient but also confident in presenting data-driven findings to leadership and other stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Science Leadership: Apply machine learning techniques, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling to help drive business growth and achieve consistent revenue targets.
Data Analysis: Work alongside cross-functional teams to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and provide valuable insights that influence strategic decision-making.
Collaboration with CEO and Leadership: Present your findings to senior leadership, especially the CEO, with confidence and clarity, ensuring data-driven strategies align with overall business goals.
Hybrid Role Flexibility: While focusing primarily on data science, you will also wear a "data analyst hat" as required to support various projects, demonstrating versatility and adaptability.
Continuous Improvement: Drive innovation in data processes, ensuring the company remains ahead of the curve in terms of tools, techniques, and industry trends.




Qualifications:

Experience: Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role, with a strong portfolio of machine learning projects and data analysis.
Technical Skills: Expertise in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar, along with experience in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving abilities with an analytical and structured approach to data.
Communication Skills: Comfortable presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders, including executives and the CEO.
Confidence and Initiative: A self-starter who is confident in their abilities to influence and collaborate with senior leadership.
Education: A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (master’s or equivalent experience is preferred).




Why This Role?

Impact: Be part of a high-growth company at the forefront of AI-powered sales tools, with direct influence on the strategic direction of the company.
Leadership Exposure: Opportunity to work closely with the CEO and other senior leaders, making key decisions and contributing to the company’s vision.
Flexibility: Enjoy the balance of a hybrid work environment, offering flexibility while remaining deeply integrated with the team.
Career Growth: Opportunity for professional development and advancement in a fast-evolving field, with room to expand your skills and leadership role.




How to Apply:

If you're a driven Data Scientist with a passion for AI and the confidence to lead, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join a company that values innovation, creativity, and impactful results.

Please note that Leyton Match is managing this search on behalf of the client. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We look forward to connecting with you.

Title: English Language Data Annotator (no experience needed) - Entry Level
Description:
Work Location: Vancouver, British Columbia; on-site

Work Schedule: Full-time (40 hours/week), Monday – Friday; business hours

Engagement Model: Employment; fixed-term/temporary




DataForce by TransPerfect is currently looking for a Language Data Annotator with fluency in English to join our team in Vancouver! This is an exciting opportunity to be part of an innovative project to improve Artificial Intelligence and technology.




This role requires a high level of independence, adaptation, and accuracy – love of attention to detail will help to succeed in this role!




Role Summary:

Language Data Annotator will focus on creating diverse and challenging prompts for an AI assistant, ensuring they reflect real-world scenarios and cover a wide range of topics and styles. Your role involves crafting prompts that test the assistant's ability to understand and execute complex instructions accurately.




No previous experience or training in the field is required - we will teach you all you need to know.




Role Responsibilities:

Develop natural language prompts that mimic human interactions, covering different styles (e.g., argumentative, narrative) and topics (e.g., science, history, technology).
Check and refine prompts to ensure they meet quality standards for natural language and user engagement.
Ensure the prompts set includes a mix of difficulty levels to assess the AI's adaptability and problem-solving skill.




Job requirements

Idiomatic fluency in English
Eligible to work in Canada
Must be of legal age (18+)
Located within a reasonable commuting distance to our Vancouver office
Great reading and comprehension skills
Ability to meet daily KPI's
Excellent time management skills
Ability to work independently
Flexibility to respond and react to changing priorities, quickly and efficiently
Ability to track, analyze, and report issues
Full-time availability (40 hours/week) for duration of the project
Ability to understand and implement feedback
Detail-oriented and comfortable with repetitive tasks




DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.




We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.




To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce
